sen.j: 稲葉 正守（いなば まさもり、享和4年1月29日 (旧暦)（1804年3月10日） - 没年不詳）は、山城国淀藩の第10代藩主。
sen.e: Masamori INABA (March 10, 1804 - year of death unknown) was the 10th lord of Yodo domain of the Yamashiro Province.
Masamori INABA (March 10, 1804 - year of death unknown) was the 10th lord of Yodo domain of the Yamashiro Province.
Masamori INABA (March 10, 1804 - year of death unknown) was the 10th lord of Yodo domain of the Yamashiro Province.
He was the 14th grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari
He was the 14th grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari
He was the 14th grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari

sen.j: 第7代藩主・稲葉正のぶの七男。
sen.e: He was the seventh son of the 7th lord of domain Masanobu INABA.
He was the seventh son of the 7th lord of domain Masanobu INABA.
He was the seventh son of the 7th lord of domain Masanobu INABA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Takasawa TODO.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Takasawa TODO.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Takasawa TODO.
He had a daughter (lawful wife of Ujiakira TODA).
He had a daughter (lawful wife of Ujiakira TODA).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、従四位下、丹後国守、佐渡国守、内匠頭。
sen.e: His ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Tango no kuni no kami (the governor of Tango Province), Sado no kuni no kami, and takumi-no-kami (the head of Bureau of Skilled Artisans).

His ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Tango no kuni no kami (the governor of Tango Province), Sado no kuni no kami, and takumi no kami (the head of Bureau of Skilled Artisans).
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: His ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Tango no kuni no kami (the governor of Tango Province), Sado no kuni no kami, and takumi no kami (the head of Bureau of Skilled Artisans).
He was born in March 10, 1804.
He was born in March 10, 1804.
He was born in March 10, 1804.
His childhood name was Tetsuya.
His childhood name was Tetsuya.
His childhood name was Tetsuya.

sen.j: 文政6年（1823年）、甥で先代藩主の稲葉正発が嗣子無くして死去したため、後を継いだ。
sen.e: Because his cousin, the late lord of domain Masaharu INABA, died without an heir, he succeeded in 1823.
Because his cousin, the late lord of domain Masaharu INABA, died without an heir, he succeeded in 1823.
Because his cousin, the late lord of domain Masaharu INABA, died without an heir, he succeeded in 1823.

sen.j: 天保9年（1838年）6月1日から天保13年（1842年）4月24日まで寺社奉行を務めている。
sen.e: He served as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) from July 21, 1838 until June 2, 1842.
He served as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) from July 21, 1838 until June 2, 1842.
He served as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) from July 21, 1838 until June 2, 1842.

sen.j: 没年はわかっていないが、天保13年（1842年）7月20日に養子で次の藩主である稲葉正誼が後を継いでいる。
sen.e: His year of death is unknown, but his adopted child and the next lord of domain Masayoshi INABA succeeded in August 25, 1842.
His year of death is unknown, but his adopted child and the next lord of domain Masayoshi INABA succeeded in August 25, 1842.
